  46. (* Interface with toplevel directives *)

  48. ‌type directive_fun =
  49.    | Directive_none of (unit -> unit)
  50.    | Directive_string of (string -> unit)
  51.    | Directive_int of (int -> unit)
  52.    | Directive_ident of (Longident.t -> unit)
  53.    | Directive_bool of (bool -> unit)

  55. ‌type directive_info = {
  56.   section: string;
  57.   doc: string;
  58. }

  60. ‌val add_directive : string -> directive_fun -> directive_info -> unit
  61.         (* Add toplevel directive and its documentation.

  63.            @since 4.03 *)

  65. ‌val get_directive : string -> directive_fun option

  67. ‌val get_directive_info : string -> directive_info option

  69. ‌val all_directive_names : unit -> string list

  71. val[@deprecated] directive_table : (string, directive_fun) Hashtbl.t
  72.   (* @deprecated please use [add_directive] instead of inserting
  73.      in this table directly. *)

  79. ‌val toplevel_env : Env.t ref
  80.         (* Typing environment for the toplevel *)

  82.         (* Initialize the typing environment for the toplevel *)
  83. ‌val print_exception_outcome : formatter -> exn -> unit
  84.         (* Print an exception resulting from the evaluation of user code. *)
  85. ‌val execute_phrase : bool -> formatter -> Parsetree.toplevel_phrase -> bool
  86.         (* Execute the given toplevel phrase. Return [true] if the
  87.            phrase executed with no errors and [false] otherwise.
  88.            First bool says whether the values and types of the results
  89.            should be printed. Uncaught exceptions are always printed. *)
  90. ‌val preprocess_phrase :
  91.       formatter -> Parsetree.toplevel_phrase ->  Parsetree.toplevel_phrase
  92.         (* Preprocess the given toplevel phrase using regular and ppx
  93.            preprocessors. Return the updated phrase. *)
  94. ‌val use_input : formatter -> input -> bool
  95. ‌val use_output : formatter -> string -> bool
  96. ‌val use_silently : formatter -> input -> bool
  97. ‌val mod_use_input : formatter -> input -> bool
  98. ‌val use_file : formatter -> string -> bool
  99.         (* Read and execute commands from a file.
  100.            [use_input] prints the types and values of the results.
  101.            [use_silently] does not print them.
  102.            [mod_use_input] wrap the file contents into a module. *)
  103. ‌val eval_module_path: Env.t -> Path.t -> Obj.t

  108. ‌val record_backtrace : unit -> unit

  165. (* Hooks *)

  167. ‌val toplevel_startup_hook : (unit -> unit) ref

  169. ‌type event = ..
  170. type event +=
  171.   | Startup
  172.   | After_setup
  173.   (* Just after the setup, when the toplevel is ready to evaluate user
  174.      input. This happens before the toplevel has evaluated any kind of
  175.      user input, in particular this happens before loading the
  176.      [.ocamlinit] file. *)

  178. ‌val add_hook : (event -> unit) -> unit
  179. (* Add a function that will be called at key points of the toplevel
  180.    initialization process. *)

  182. ‌val run_hooks : event -> unit
  183. (* Run all the registered hooks. *)

  185. (* Used by Trace module *)

  187. ‌val may_trace : bool ref

  189. (* Misc *)

  191. ‌val override_sys_argv : string array -> unit
  192. (* [override_sys_argv args] replaces the contents of [Sys.argv] by [args]
  193.    and reset [Arg.current] to [0].

  195.    This is called by [run_script] so that [Sys.argv] represents
  196.    "script.ml args..." instead of the full command line:
  197.    "ocamlrun unix.cma ... script.ml args...". *)
